entry.def: A map is a drawing of a particular area such as a city, a country, or a continent, showing its main features as they would appear if you looked at them from above.

example.ex: He unfolded the map and set it on the floor...
example.tran: 他打开地图，放在了地板上。

example.ex: Have you got a map of the city centre?

entry.def: A map is a drawing that gives special information about an area.
To map an area means to make a map of it.

example.ex: ...a spacecraft which is using radar to map the surface of Venus.
example.tran: 使用雷达绘制金星表面地图的宇宙飞船
对海底地形的更精确绘制

entry.def: If you say that someone or something put a person, thing, or place on the map, you approve of the fact that they made it become well-known and important.

example.ex: ...the attempts of the Edinburgh Festival's organisers to put C.P. Taylor firmly on the map...
example.tran: 爱丁堡艺术节的组织者们为使C.P.泰勒名扬四海所作的努力

example.ex: This could put cider back on the map as one of our great national drinks.
example.tran: 这样可以让苹果酒再度名扬四方，成为我们重要的国酒之一。

means.word_mean: 1. a function such that for every element of one set there is a unique element of another set
